page.title: 10Transport
page.content: The building of the Seamer & Cross- gates by-pass will commence in 1986. Several alternative routes were proposed to provide a quick & easy route to the east coast.The route chosen will cut down on the unaccept- able level of noise,congestion & fumes from the slow moving traffic in summer .It will also improve road safety.The route chosen will be,on completion 2.2 miles in length.It will cost over Â£8. million.The route will start on the A64 and go north east along the side of the existing York to Scarborough railway line.This route is least harm- ful as agricultural interests are con- cerned.Only one house will be demol- ished & 8 houses will be affected by noise.The public were asked to fill in a questionaire for the by-pass.A majority of 69% chose the route which is going to be built.
